channel.title: A way for a redesign?
channel.description: Is there a way for a full redesign of every aspect of the game, from the maps to the monsters? If so, please guide me in the right direction.

item.description:

item.title: A way for a redesign?

item.description:
@jurm wrote:

Thanks silab! Do you know the way to open the DAT files?

EDIT: Also, I can make a new user sidepanel as well, and new monsters, ect. right? Thanks for all the help. PS I am getting an error on compile-class in the moparscape folder

Read full topic

item.title: A way for a redesign?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

mod taharok:

If you wanted to build your own game, you see when you run the server it is just using the collision files and models from moparscape server. So everytime your running a server your using moparscape databases. (moparscape 2+ up can run offline). Also unless you hand-built your own client and made every single model and made the collision files for them and the data files for them, you have to live with what moparscape offers you - which is what you will get in RS2.

that was a paragraph of false statements good job,
1 moparscape has a built in hybridscape server
2 their is no database
3 dat files are client side
4 collision files? rofl
5. Can you add your own monsters and redesign the map (yes), you would have to be able to edit the dat files to do so.
6. “live what moparscape gives you” lol

please only comment if you really know something on the subject

Read full topic

item.title: A way for a redesign?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

If you wanted to build your own game, you see when you run the server it is just using the collision files and models from moparscape server. So everytime your running a server your using moparscape databases. (moparscape 2+ up can run offline). Also unless you hand-built your own client and made every single model and made the collision files for them and the data files for them, you have to live with what moparscape offers you - which is what you will get in RS2.
